elements.text:
btn([b], [pl]) returns whether the button "b" is
currently being held down.
[b] is an integer from 0 to 15 indicating the
value of the button being pressed.
[b] values:
1: Keyboard Left Arrow / Left Stick Left
2: Keyboard Right Arrow / Left Stick Right
3: Keyboard Up Arrow / Left Stick Up
4: Keyboard Down Arrow / Left Stick Down
5: Keyboard Z / Controller A
6: Keyboard X / Controller X
7: Keyboard ENTER / Controller Pause
8: Keyboard A / Right Stick Left
9: Keyboard D / Right Stick Right
10: Keyboard W / Right Stick Up
11: Keyboard S / Right Stick Down
12: Keyboard F / Controller B
13: Keyboard G / Controller Y
14: Keyboard Q / Left Bumper
15: Keyboard E / Right Bumper

As you may have noticed, 7 does not have an
assigned button or key.
The code below prints the button being currently
held down.

function _init()
cbtn = "none"
end
function _update()
if btn(0) then cbtn = "Left Arrow / Left Stick Left"
elseif btn(1) then cbtn = "Right Arrow / Left Stick Right"
elseif btn(2) then cbtn = "Up Arrow / Left Stick Up"
elseif btn(3) then cbtn = "Down Arrow / Left Stick Down"
elseif btn(4) then cbtn = "Keyboard Z / Controller A"
elseif btn(5) then cbtn = "Keyboard X / Controller X"
elseif btn(6) then cbtn = "Keyboard ENTER / Controller Pause"
elseif btn(7) then cbtn = "You found it"
elseif btn(8) then cbtn = "Keyboard A / Right Stick Left"
elseif btn(9) then cbtn = "Keyboard D / Right Stick Right"
elseif btn(10) then cbtn = "Keyboard W / Right Stick Up"
elseif btn(11) then cbtn = "Keyboard S / Right Stick Down"
elseif btn(12) then cbtn = "Keyboard F / Controller B"
elseif btn(13) then cbtn = "Keyboard G / Controller Y"
elseif btn(14) then cbtn = "Keyboard Q / Left Bumper"
elseif btn(15) then cbtn = "Keyboard E / Right Bumper"
else cbtn = "none" end
end
function _draw()
cls()
print("Button: " .. cbtn)
end
